Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti of the scribe Har
Description: This funerary statuette is made of greeny-brown faience. Its feet are missing and it is inscribed for the scribe Hor. The inscriptions are written in seven horizontal lines and one vertical column and consist of hieroglyphs of mediocre quality. The text is a version of Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead.
